SEARCH

Class SchellingModel

java.lang.Object
AbstractGame
SchellingModel
public class SchellingModel extends AbstractGame
Implementation of Schelling's model of segregation. In this model, cells represent agents of different types (colors). Agents move to a new location if the number of similar neighbors is below a certain threshold.

  • Constructor Details

    • SchellingModel

      public SchellingModel(int rows, int columns, int nbOfColors, int threshold)
      Constructs a SchellingModel with specified dimensions, number of colors, and threshold.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the model grid.
      columns - The number of columns in the model grid.
      nbOfColors - The number of different colors (states) in the model.
      threshold - The satisfaction threshold for agents.

  • Method Details

    • isRelevantNeighbor

      public boolean isRelevantNeighbor(int originRow, int originColumn, int neighborRow, int neighborColumn)
      Determines whether a neighboring cell is relevant for the current cell's satisfaction. In SchellingModel, a neighbor is relevant if it is not of the same type and not vacant.
      Specified by:
      isRelevantNeighbor in class AbstractGame
      Parameters:
      originRow - The row index of the original cell.
      originColumn - The column index of the original cell.
      neighborRow - The row index of the neighboring cell.
      neighborColumn - The column index of the neighboring cell.
      Returns:
      true if the neighbor is relevant, false otherwise.

    • move

      public void move(Cell from, Cell to)
      Moves an agent from one cell to another.
      Parameters:
      from - The cell from which the agent moves.
      to - The cell to which the agent moves.

    • searchForNewHouse

      public Cell searchForNewHouse(Cell cell)
      Searches for a new house for a dissatisfied agent.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell representing the agent looking for a new house.
      Returns:
      A vacant house cell, or null if none are available.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state of the model based on Schelling's segregation rules. Agents move to a new location if the number of similar neighbors is below the threshold.
      Specified by:
      update in class AbstractGame

    • getNbOfColors

      public int getNbOfColors()
      Gets the number of colors (types of agents) in the model.
      Returns:
      The number of colors.
